title: How to Clean a Gameboy Cartridge
category_hierarchy: Video Game Console Maintenance and Repair

steps.headline: This may need to be the only step taken for some people.
steps.description: Get the keyboard duster air can and hold it about half inch away from the cartridge. Blow air in the cartridge until you are satisfied. Test the game to see if it works.

steps.headline: If that didn't work, take a q-tip and dip it in the water quickly, don't hold it under long.
steps.description: If needed squeeze excess water out of the q-tip so that it is damp.

steps.headline: Now, take the damp side and stick it in the cartridge and gently wipe it from side to side.
steps.description: Get a paper towel and wipe off dripping water (if any, but there shouldn't be).

steps.headline: Turn the q-tip to the dry side and do the same as with the wet side.
steps.description: Wait 10 minutes for extra moisture to dry.

text: This may need to be the only step taken for some people. Get the keyboard duster air can and hold it about half inch away from the cartridge. Blow air in the cartridge until you are satisfied. Test the game to see if it works. If that didn't work, take a q-tip and dip it in the water quickly, don't hold it under long. If needed squeeze excess water out of the q-tip so that it is damp. Now, take the damp side and stick it in the cartridge and gently wipe it from side to side. Get a paper towel and wipe off dripping water (if any, but there shouldn't be). Turn the q-tip to the dry side and do the same as with the wet side. Wait 10 minutes for extra moisture to dry.
